title: ARAM is NOT Random, and it's getting worse.
body:
I know for 100% fact that ARAM in absolutely NOT all random. lately I have been getting champs I never play at a constant rate, and it feels like a pool of about 20 champs. I never get champs I actually play, Like MF, Jinx, Ahri, ETC. And I do mean NEVER. I probably havnt pulled MF without trade in over a year, but I get champs like syndra (Who I actually do play and enjoy thank god), poppy, nunu, aatrox, LEONA quite frequently recently, ETC. I liked ARAM when it was as it's name implied. I didn't care if I got absolutely roflstomped because my team comp was trash, because it was exciting not knowing what I would get vs who. now I can list the 10 champs I get more often by many times over and its just not fun anymore. Bring back REAL ARAM Rito, wtf are you thinking? If you want to make KINDA random all mid, go ahead and create another game mode for people who want that, but keep ARAM random.
Edit, this is Feb-5-2020 and I own all but like 15 champs or around there

replies.body:
I only know that ARAM balance changes are a big joke and just make a lot of champions really unfun to play while others are still blatantly overpowered.
Like the global healing reduction and oracle elixirs... so dumb.

You seen the new changes?

Trynd can crit 10% harder now and takes less damage (less damage than invulnerable... sure), how is any squishy backline going to deal with him now?
Kassadin, who in ARAM I've seen more pentas on him this year than anyone else, is now 10% harder to kill. 
Qiyana can now do 10% more damage with that god damn ult too. 
LB who oneshots everyone already can now oneshot even quicker.

No reason why any of these champs need to kill people faster but there we have it.

Reason they struggle in ARAM has nothing to do with power, it's their and ARAM's design. All these changes will do it frustrate people who get given champs like Kog, Ziggs (who got an extra 2% damage taken) or Sona. They will feel like they do nothing while assassins are rewarded for being stupid already.

/Rant over.

it is freaking random , but includes most of people's champions' pool , of course everyone own MF and Lux , and not everyone own Yorick and Volibear , you gotta get used to it.

See the problem there is, the likelihood of me not receiving MF for over an entire year, regardless of the ARAM only accounts, is so obscenely low, that it cannot possibly have happened for so long. Add to that, that I actually rarely see MF in ANY games at all, that makes the chances I don't get her even lower, as she wasn't rolled by anyone. There is no way, given the way random selection works, that even when presented with the idea of ARAM accounts the odds are even between champions. for example like I mentioned before, I get Syndra all the time, and she is practically a god-tier ARAM champ. FAR more often than should be anywhere NEAR random.

Bruh , MF is sexy , she is like the first bought champion ( after Ashe ) for half of the player base , regardless what's her current state in the meta , she has always been one of the most aram picked champions overall.

I've had days where I get the same champ 3 or 4 times IN A ROW lucky I can normally trade them away or have a RR.

I get Kat WAY too many times for RNG Xin, Vi aswell. Arams likes to ram melee champs down my throat and I hate them so much.

At least they stopped giving me Garen LEGIT every 3rd game.

As their looting system is not random, I guess that Aram could be not-random as well. All-melee teams happen suspiciously frequently (probably all-ranged ones too, but they are less "problematic").

Also, Aram-only account are a problem, and sadly this company allowed them, without any counter-measure.

I would say they are less of a problem now than ever.

We got 3x the free rotation + the "adjustments"

So, it's not like maokai/sona/ziggs/velkoz have the same agency they used to.

Having said that, of course unlocking the entire roster for everyone would be the only way to make the mode 100% fair.
Without specific knowledge of the algorithm in use, it is logically impossible to state with 100% certainty whether a given system is random.
However true that may be, the probability of me being right, with the observations made over the course of a year backed by MANY other players makes it extremely improbable that I am wrong.

You say "a year"

Does that mean 1k games? Does that mean 5k games? Does that mean 200 games? 

And you are 100% wrong because there is NO REASON for aram not to be random.

But the more champions you have the least chance you have to roll them, and of the champs you own the least likely ones to get are the ones that are popular.


If you check like your last 5k games. You will see it's random.
